conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet by analyzing their motion using the v-t graph.

The v-t graph shows the velocity of particles A and B over time. Particle A changes velocity from 0 to 2v0 and back to 0. Particle B starts at 0, increases to a maximum less than 2v0, and decreases back to 0.
The area under the velocity-time graph gives the distance covered.
Distance covered by A is calculated as 2v0t0.
Distance covered by B is calculated as 2v0t0 using the area of the trapezoid.
Both particles cover the same distance 2v0t0, so they meet when they have covered this distance.
Particles A and B meet at t = 3t0.
